lines.gurmukhi: jYsy ibnu locn iblokIAY n rUp rMig s√çn ibhUMn rwg nwd n sunIjIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Binu Lochan Bilokeeai N Roop Rangi , Sravan Bihoonn Raag Naad N Souneejeeai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as without eyes a face cannot be seen and without ears, no musical note can be heard.

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy ibnu ijhbw n aucrY bcn Ar nwskw ibhUMn bws bwsnw n lIjIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Binu Jihabaa N Oucharai Bachan Ara , Naasakaa Bihoonn Baas Baasanaa N Leejeeai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as without tongue, no word can be spoken and without nose no fragrance can be smelled.

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy ibnu kr kir skY n ikrq kRm crn ibhUMn Baun gaun kq kIjIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Binu Kar Kari Sakai N Kirat Krama , Charan Bihoonn Bhaoun Gaoun Kat Keejeeai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as without hands no accomplishable work can be done and without feet no place can be reached.

lines.gurmukhi: Asn bsn ibnu DIrju n DrY dyh ibnu gur sbd n pRym rsu pIjIAY ]533]
lines.transliteration_english: Asan Basan Binu Dheeraju N Dharai Dayha , Binu Gur Sabad N Praym Rasu Peejeeai ?533?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as without food and clothes a body cannot be kept healthy; similarly without the teachings and divine words obtainable from the True Guru, the wondrous elixir of Lord's love cannot be relished.  (533)
